$comment: Please do not edit this schema by hand. Generate it instead by running npm run build:schema.

type.description: the type of event recorded. Either WebScience.advertisements, WebScience.articleContents, WebScience.pageNav, or WebScience.pageNavSensitive

userId.description: a unique ID associated with a participant.

visitId.description: a unique ID associated with a page visit.

body.description: This object contains two properties listed below about the <body> tag of the page.  This is needed to normalize the size of advertisments against full page size.

body.clientHeight.description: The calculated height in pixels of the <body> tag

body.clientWidth.description: The calculated width in pixels of the <body> tag

ads.description: This array contains an object per advertisement found

ads.id.description: The ID of the ad, if listed in the HTML element

ads.tag.description: The HTML tag type that the ad was in

ads.clientHeight.description: The calculated height of the ad HTML element in pixels

ads.clientWidth.description: The calculated width of the ad HTML element in pixels

ads.height.description: The height of the HTML element, as listed in it's style attributes

ads.width.description: The width of the HTML element, as listed in it's style attributes

tabId.description: The ID of the tab this data was collected from

url.description: The URL of the page visited
